newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine blue-chips close up 2.28 pct.
newsitem.headline: Argentine blue-chips close up 2.28 pct.

text.p: Argentine stocks closed sharply up Wednesday as institutional investors returned to the market to partly compensate for the falls of the previous two sessions, traders said.
The blue chip MerVal index ended up 2.28 percent at 826.37, and returned to the upward path charted for it by stock analysts for the medium term.
"Everyone in the market was cool again today. Yesterday's profit-taking was short-lived," said broker Luis Corsiglia.
The blue chip MerVal index tumbled 3.37 percent to 807.91 after closing off 1.7 percent Monday.
The market was spooked Tuesday by rumors of an imminent Brazilian devaluation.
Buenos Aires' general share index closed up 0.9 percent.
Some 40 stocks closed up, 25 lower, and 22 unchanged. Turnover was $43.6 million, up from $39.6 million Tuesday.
Shares in oil firm YPF eased 0.35 pesos to 30.05 pesos, after 10 percent of shares which had belonged to its workers were sold in an auction at $29.25 each.
Buenos Aires also benefitted from a rise on Wall Street.
Traders said they expected the market to remain firm for the rest of the week, but in selective trading.
